respStmt.resp: Conversion to TEI based on earlier work for the ENRICH project (enrich@oucs.ox.ac.uk; http://tei.oucs.ox.ac.uk/ENRICH/)

msItem.author: Ambrose
msItem.title: Expositio de Psalmo CXVIII
msItem.rubric: In nomine sancte trinitatis. Incipit expositio de psalmo centesimo octauodecimo sancti Ambrosii mediolanensis urbis episcopi
msItem.explicit: (22.29.2) dignaris suscipere quem inueneris, inponere umeris quem susceperis. Qui cum patre
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber ambrosii [in the ink of the text]
msItem.note: Fols. 1r-2r are reject leaves of the same text (1.1 to 1.14 'per euangelium per apostolos|').

msItem.author: Odo of Glanfeuil (Ps.-Faustus)
msItem.title: Vita S. Mauri
msItem.incipit: Faustus famulorum christi famulus omnibus monachis qui sunt in oriente et occidente
Postquam diuinitas domini et saluatoris nostri
Beatissimus igitur Maurus clarissimo senatorum genere patre euticio
msItem.explicit: annis .xl. diebus xiiij. Per omnia benedictus deus qui regnat in secula seculorum amen

msItem.author: Sebastian of Monte Cassino (?)
msItem.title: Vita S. Hieronymi presbiteri
msItem.incipit: Plerosque nimirum illustrium uirorum non ambigo nosse
msItem.explicit: saluos facere et ad adnitionem ueritatis uenire, qui cum patre
msItem.note: Part of fol. 168rb blank; fol. 168v blank.

msItem.title: Vita S. Lucae evangelistae
msItem.incipit: Igitur gloriosissimus apostolus et ewangelista ihesu christi domini lucas natione fuit syrus ciuis antiocensis, arte nichilominus medicus, discipulus autem apostolorum
msItem.explicit: Hoc autem diuina prouidentia constat actumm, ut scilicet per plura per omnia secula seculorum amen
msItem.note: Fol. 171vb contains the first eight capitula for the following item ('Quibus provectibus ... Machinatio ...') as pr. MGH SS rer. Merov. IV.283.

msItem.title: Vita et miracula S. Galli
msItem.explicit: Secundus mirabilia que post modum per merita eius dominus ostendit manifestat
msItem.rubric: (fol. 187rb) Incipit liber primus de miraculis que post obitum sancti Galli dominus per eum facere dignatus est
msItem.incipit: Meritis beatissimi Galli cotidie per miraculorum
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber primus de miraculis sancti Gall confessoris
msItem.incipit: Preterea tam multa furore demonum per eiusdem sancti patris merita sunt liberati
msItem.note: Part of 192va blank, fol. 192vb blank (II. 32 and II. 33).

msItem.title: Vita S. Otmari
msItem.incipit: Igitur hotmarus genere alamannorum oriundus in etate puerili a fratre suo rethiani curiensem perductus est

msItem.note: Sequence for St Benedict: Analecta Hymnica 54.52-3 (no. 35); Walther 17235; Chevalier 18542; SK 14653; addition, thirteenth century.

msItem.title: 'Sunday list'
msItem.note: Note of events in sacred history occuring on Sunday similar to those found in later versions of the 'Sunday letter': creation, creation of the angels, crossing the Red Sea, manna, the miracle at Cana, feeding of the five thousand, baptism of Christ, resurrection, Pentecost, Day of Judgement; see C. Lees, 'The ‘Sunday Letter’ and the ‘Sunday Lists’', Anglo-Saxon England 14 (1985), 129-151. Addition, thirteenth century.
msItem.incipit: In die dominica creata sunt omnia. in die dominico omnia consumnauit deus ex quo ceteri lucem accipiunt sicut est clarior sol aliis sideribus, ita dominica clarior est omnibus diebus
msItem.explicit: In die dominico erit dies iudicii

decoDesc.decoNote: Red silhouette (arabesque) initials with penwork decoration, in the same style as MSS. Laud Misc. 222, Laud Misc. 287 and London, BL, Arundel MS. 245.

origin.origDate: 13th century, first half or middle (second quarter?)

history.provenance: Eberbach, Cistercian abbey: ex libris, fol. 200v, 14th century (?) (reworked fifteenth or sixteenth century).

Identifiable as b27 in the Eberbach library catalogue of 1502 (Palmer, p. 265: 'Ambrosius super psalmum Beati immaculati. Item vita sancti maurj abbatis. Vita sancti Iheronimi. Vita sancti luce ewangeliste. Vita galli confessoris. Vita othmari abbatis. Initium Licet mistice.')
history.acquisition: Part of his third donation to the Bodleian, 1639.

recordHist.source:
Description adapted by Matthew Holford (June 2020) from the following (with additional description of content): Nigel F. Palmer, Zisterzienser und ihre Bücher: die mittelalterliche Bibliotheksgeschichte von Kloster Eberbach im Rheingau (Regensburg, 1998), pp. 109, 209-10, 284 [physical description, date, provenance]. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858-1885)
Quarto Catalogue, cols. 199-200 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 43

listBibl.bibl: Otto Pächt and J. J. G. Alexander, Illuminated Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library Oxford, I (1966), no. 119 [part 1: origin]
